title: Big broker syndicate lined up for CBA's new PERLS
text:
Eleven brokers have launched Commonwealth Bank of Australia's latest PERLS raising – a targeted $750 million-plus effort with an indicative margin of 3 to 3.2 per cent.

The brokers launched the deal on Wednesday morning as CBA lodged a prospectus with the corporate regulator for its new CommBank PERLS XII Capital Notes.

The firms on the ticket include CBA, ANZ, Morgan Stanley, Morgans, NAB, Ord Minnett, UBS and Westpac as joint lead managers, while Crestone, Bell Potter and Evans Dixon were hired as co-managers.

The brokers have been given a week to sell the subordinated unsecured notes before a bookbuild to price the deal on October 16.

Potential investors were told the margin was expected to be 3 per cent to 3.2 per cent a year above the bank bill swap rate.

If succeessful, the securities were slated to hit the ASX boards on November 15 on a deferred settlement basis.
